title: The Underground Railroad
author: Colson Whitehead
description: A novel that follows Cora, a slave on a cotton plantation in Georgia, as she makes a desperate bid for freedom in the antebellum South through the Underground Railroad.

title: My Brilliant Friend
author: Elena Ferrante
description: The story of Elena and Lila, two friends growing up in a poor neighborhood in Naples, exploring themes of friendship, social class, and the challenges of being a woman.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A touching novel about two teenagers, both cancer patients, who meet in a support group and fall in love, exploring themes of love, loss, and existence.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A fantasy novel set around an enchanting competition between two young illusionists at a magical circus that only operates at night, exploring themes of love, magic, and rivalry.

title: All the Light We Cannot See
author: Anthony Doerr
description: Set during World War II, the novel tells the story of a blind French girl and a German boy whose paths collide in occupied France.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
description: A profound tale of friendship and love in New York City, centering on four friends over several decades, with a focus on one character's struggle with his past.

title: The Overstory
author: Richard Powers
description: A novel about trees and a group of people who come together to save the last remnants of virgin forest, exploring the connection between human and plant life.

title: Life After Life
author: Kate Atkinson
description: The story of Ursula Todd, born in 1910, who dies and is reborn multiple times, living through the events of the 20th century differently in each life.

title: The Art of Fielding
author: Chad Harbach
description: A coming-of-age story set against the backdrop of college baseball, exploring friendship, ambition, and the pressures of success.

title: There There
author: Tommy Orange
description: A novel that delves into the lives of twelve Native American characters living in Oakland, California, examining their struggles with identity, community, and history.
